|Title=Antipsychotics: knowing how to prescribe in emergency situations
|Description=Preferred molecules, pre-therapeutic assessment, route of administration
|Rubric=Emergency identification
|Contributors=Louise Carton,Florian Naudet,Marie Tournier
|Order=7}}

Antipsychotics may be prescribed in "emergency" cases of agitation or suicidal crisis. Route of administration :

*per os whenever possible
*or intramuscularly.

Recommended treatments for agitation: in psychotic and bipolar disorders, a "per os" antipsychotic treatment if possible ("olanzapine", "aripiprazole", "levomepromazine") or intramuscular ("olanzapine", "aripiprazole" and "levomepromazine").

Cyamemazine carries a risk of arterial hypotension.

The "pre-therapeutic assessment" is based on the ECG whenever possible. In the case of major states of agitation, the ECG should be taken after administration, and the reasons for this should be recorded in the medical record.

question.title: What is the recommended route of administration for antipsychotics in emergency situations?
question.description: Antipsychotics may be prescribed in emergency cases of agitation or suicidal crisis. Route of administration :

option_a.title: Intramuscularly only
option_a.description: This option is plausible, but not entirely accurate, as it does not mention the possibility of oral administration.

option_b.title: Per os whenever possible, and intramuscularly only in cases of severe agitation
option_b.description: This option is partially correct, but the wording is ambiguous and may confuse respondents.

option_c.title: Per os whenever possible, and intramuscularly after ECG assessment
option_c.description: This option is accurate and reflects the recommended treatment protocol.

option_d.title: Intramuscularly only, as oral administration can lead to poor absorption
option_d.description: This option is incorrect, as it contradicts the recommended route of administration and ignores the possibility of oral administration.
